etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in The Penny Cyclopaedia. From phloro- + -etin, after French phlorétine

definitions: A crystalline phenolic compound with a bicyclic molecular structure, the aglycone of phlorizin; 3-(4-hydroxyphenyl)-1-(2,4,6-trihydroxyphenyl)-1-propanone, C₁₅ H₁₄ O₅.
